TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit UpdatePanelTriggerCollection extends System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection`1<class System.Web.UI.UpdatePanelTrigger>

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of objects for an control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Triggers in the <xref:System.Web.UI.UpdatePanelTrigger> collection are specified by using the **UpdatePanelTrigger Collection Editor** in the designer or by adding them declaratively as `<Triggers>` elements inside the <xref:System.Web.UI.UpdatePanel> control. You can add two types of triggers:
- An <xref:System.Web.UI.AsyncPostBackTrigger> object that can be used to specify that a control can cause an asynchronous postback and refresh the update panel's contents. The <xref:System.Web.UI.AsyncPostBackTrigger> object is used for controls outside an update panel or controls that are not immediate child controls of an <xref:System.Web.UI.UpdatePanel> control.
- A <xref:System.Web.UI.PostBackTrigger> object that can be used to specify that a postback control inside an <xref:System.Web.UI.UpdatePanel> control can cause a synchronous postback and a full-page refresh.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Web.UI.UpdatePanel owner) cil managed

Docs.param: The control that the belongs to.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the collection class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You typically add triggers to an <xref:System.Web.UI.UpdatePanel> control by using the **UpdatePanelTrigger Collection Editor** in the designer or by adding them declaratively as `<Triggers>` elements inside the <xref:System.Web.UI.UpdatePanel> control.

Docs.param: The zero-based index at which the trigger should be inserted.
The trigger to insert. The value can be for reference types.
Docs.summary: Inserts an object into the object at the specified index.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can add <xref:System.Web.UI.AsyncPostBackTrigger> objects, <xref:System.Web.UI.PostBackTrigger> objects, or any custom trigger that derives from <xref:System.Web.UI.UpdatePanelTrigger>.

Docs.summary: Gets a reference to the control that the belongs to.

The new value for the trigger at the specified index. The value can be for reference types.
Docs.summary: Replaces the trigger at the specified index in the object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can replace an element in the <xref:System.Web.UI.UpdatePanelTriggerCollection> object with an <xref:System.Web.UI.AsyncPostBackTrigger> object, a <xref:System.Web.UI.PostBackTrigger> object, or any custom trigger that derives from <xref:System.Web.UI.UpdatePanelTrigger>.
